pages.text: Not all materials in engineering are as straightforward as wood, stone and various metals. A basic understanding of chemical processes is essential to appreciate the breadth of materials available to you.

Nitrate Dust (also known as saltpeter) is an alkali salt found by processing Sandstone in a $(l:patchouli:heavy/crusher)Crusher$(). $(br)It is used as a catalyst in the creation of $(l:patchouli:heavy/refinery)Biodiesel$(), and can be used to craft Fertilizer as shown above.

Sulfur Dust is a powder found in certain ores and commonly in $(l:patchouli:overview/mineral_deposits)Mineral Deposits$(). It can be found occasionally by $(l:patchouli:heavy/crusher)crushing$() $(#007500)Lapis Lazuli$() or $(#007500)Coal Ore$() blocks and more commonly in $(#007500)Nether Quartz Ore$(). It can also be extracted reliably from $(#007500)Blaze Rods$().
Mixing Nitrate, Sulfur and Charcoal allows for the creation of gunpowder, a far more scientific process than looting it from slain monsters.
